comment: You either will need to be reading on your book (or researching online and looking up JDocs) and be caught up every week with your assignments (typically around 8 labs a week + 2 hw assignments). There is no lectures, since this is a hybrid class, and the only thing you'll probably be doing are the labs or procrastinating and doing other things.

He is an incredibly difficult professor. He specializes his class so much, that if you come from a different professor you won't pass. He hates questions that are outside the class. Not sure how he still has his job. His "10 years industry experience" is a lie. This man clearly isn't professional and shows it in every lecture.

Dr. Jones is a great professor. He drops 8 grades... so you can fail 8 assignments (2 from each section i.e hw, lab and quizzes)& still get ATLEAST an A or B. I do research with him and attended a seminar he put together for students about maintaining their health. He really does care about his students. You MUST read and watch the videos (hybrid)

He expects every student to put at least 16 hours a week for his course. He does not welcome anyone who cannot code the way he does; he is picky on the way you format your code. He gives 12 programs a week (he says its only six small programs but in each section its two). You get one week to do that and for some odd reason 2 for the homework.

I had a fledging interest in computer science. He stomped it out of me. Be prepared to work for at least a solid 2 hours every single day after class because the workload is relentless. And if you get just one thing wrong on the homework, you get a 0 for the assignment. Just be sure you know you love coding as that is all you will be doing.

Majority of the content he contributes is the genuine threats of zero points for mistakes. Finds a lot of things to take points for but  does not show the same effort to help students. Negligent to the degree it is insulting, barely grades any assignments and in weeks even months and if he does, never provides feedback. STAY AWAY!

Dr. Jones is extremely helpful and willing to work with you to get you through the class. My only complaint is we are still waiting on grades from our homework that was turned in near the beginning of the semester. Due to a hybrid class, he did not have full control over what was being taught, but he offered a lot of extra credit to help grades.

I'd give him 5's across the board if he was actually able to teach his own curriculum. His real world approach and insight (which you only get to see in snippets) is the most interesting part of the class. The rest of the class time is spent either being boggled by Hhaddads bizarre curriculum or watching the professor himself be boggled by it.

Made learning java a lot easier than the lectures provided by Haddad. The class was a hybrid so there were no lectures, but Dr. Jones made the class a lot easier and java easier to learn. He was always attempting to reach out. It's programming so it is still going to be no easy A, but he dumbs everything down. Signing up for 2302 with him.
